CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 14, 1945, pg. 1 reads: "In Training - Mardis Hall, 521 Herron Avenue, formerly of Library, was among the first five Negroes selected for training as trolley and bus operators this week. Mr. Hall is shown operating a training car on the "Grassy rail" track at Castle Shannon barns this morning (Thursday), while Pittsburgh Railways Instructor Edward Golden stands behind him. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Railways instructor Edward Golden, observing Mardis Hall training on streetcar at the Castle Shannon trolley barn
